page.title: 14The Melplash Show.
page.content: The Melplash Show dates back to 1847 when two Dorset farmers accepted a challenge to prove who was the better ploughman. The Melplash Agricultural Society was then formed and the first show took place in Melplash in 1850. It is now held on the last Thursday in August on the riverside meadows between Bridport and West Bay though it still retains its title as the Melplash Show. The Show invites competition in a wide variety of farming and livestock attracting exhibitors from far afield as well as locally. There are also some 150 Trade Stands where visitors can go shopping. There are sections for Horticulture, Handicrafts and Home Produce and there is usually a special attraction such as an Aerobatic Team or Royal Navy helicopters.
